newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy amusement park aims for bourse listing-paper.
newsitem.headline: Italy amusement park aims for bourse listing-paper.

text.p: Italy's biggest amusement park, Gardaland, is set to seek a listing on the Milan stock exchange, Italian newspaper La Repubblica reported on Saturday.

The paper said the proposal would be put to the small band of existing shareholders at a meeting on July 14. It added that directors intended to issue some 2.9 million new shares with a nominal value of 1,000 lire per share.
Gardaland, which is headed by Franco Riccardi and based near northern Italy's Lake Garda, saw net profits rise 21 percent last year to 10.9 billion on turnover of 109.8 billion lire.
The site attracted a total of 482,000 visitors in 1996, slightly down on 1995 levels.
No-one was available for comment at the company. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
